phrases.cultural_note: An expression of doing something with joy, in this manner

phrases.literal_translation: will work on the body first
phrases.cultural_note: Will do medicine work to treat the bodies
The healer will protect him/herself first
And align their medicine energy first for proper channeling
Align all of their connection structures to the highest frequency

phrases.root_meaning: to speak, say, invoke by word
phrases.literal_translation: While I am speaking, invoking excellently
phrases.cultural_note: The healer invokes their medicine energy for greater connection
Now they begin to clear, do the healing

phrases.literal_translation: will work on the universe first
phrases.cultural_note: They begin from the energetic universe of the patient. The Shipibo believe that on the energetic plane, people have a "universe". These are all the universe of energies that conform a person.
They express joy while doing the healing
They describe their body bending, inclining while doing the healing in a form of ancestral dance
All the bodies are being treated
Healer is blowing away the negative energies
Healer will look, in the sense of diagnosing the bodies with vision
Healer will wait, in the sense waiting to see and connect with the energies for appropriate diagnosis

vocabulary.meaning: to speak, say, invoke by word

phrases.cultural_note: An expression of being or doing with joy, in this manner
Rhythmic exclamation. An expression of being or doing with joy, in this manner
An expression of being or doing with joy, in this manner

phrases.root_meaning: to be, iki present tense conjugation
phrases.cultural_note: Expression referring to celebratory verbalizations, songs, prayers
The healer has connected very well with their medicine
Rhythmic exclamation. The healer has connected very well with their medicine
Their medicine referring to all of the dieta energy cultivated in them
They are describing their connection, which is full of embroidery. An 'embroidered energy' symbolizes a beautiful and medicinal connection that took years of dieta to refine.
In this case, the healer's medicine has many connections to all kinds of energies that make up their shamanic toolbox
Rhythmic exclamation

In this case, Don Miguel has a very close connection to the Chullachaki spirit. He is a doctor of Chullachaki. Medico is Spanish for 'doctor'. Used in icaros to refer to medicines or medicinal frequencies.
The 'gods' refer to the plant spirits. A connection to their universe.

phrases.root_meaning: to descend, many objects or a mass
phrases.literal_translation: Are welcomed as they are descending
phrases.cultural_note: These spirits come descending from the heavens to the maestro to aid in healing

phrases.literal_translation: Are welcomed as they are descending
phrases.cultural_note: Rhythmic exclamation

phrases.root_meaning: do as you approach (plural or transitive)
phrases.cultural_note: Not only the maestro but the patients as well. The spirits come to help.
And are connecting very beautifully

phrases.literal_translation: In the depths of their own universe
phrases.cultural_note: Referring to the universe of the spirits, in the depths of the spirit's universe.

phrases.literal_translation: In the depths of their own universe
phrases.cultural_note: Rhythmic exclamation
The energies of the dieta are connected to the universe of the spirits as mentioned above

phrases.literal_translation: Containing huge towers in line (huge power)
phrases.cultural_note: Speaking to the immense energies of the towers. The towers refer to medicine temples as seen in the ayahuasca visions or dream space. Temples symbolize divine energy, the highest frequency medicine energy available in the plant medicine realms. The universe of the plant spirits is full of these towers in a line.

vocabulary.meaning: Spanish for 'doctor'; used in icaros to refer to medicines or medicinal frequencies
to descend, many objects or a mass
do as you approach (plural or transitive)

phrases.root_meaning: Niwe: wind-like energy; Tori: from Spanish torre, tower; Campana: from Spanish campana, bell
phrases.literal_translation: the energetic bell from the tower
phrases.cultural_note: The bell in an energetic tower symbolizes the medicine of sound, the force of the icaros
With this icaro medicine, the greatest universe opens. Speaking of medicinal frequencies

phrases.root_meaning: Noya Rao: Flying Medicine (Noya means 'Flying', Rao means 'medicine'); Rios: from Spanish Dios, God
phrases.cultural_note: The spirits of Noya Rao

phrases.literal_translation: the energies (of the spirits) in line
phrases.cultural_note: The energy of Noya Rao is arranged in a line

phrases.root_meaning: Joni: person or man; Tsoawa: species of amazonian bird, symbolizing medicine, a doctor
phrases.cultural_note: The bird, tsoawa, is a metaphor for a medicinal energy; in this case the healer refers to the medicine spirit presenting itself
Begins to do the healing after connecting to the force of his icaro

phrases.root_meaning: Min: your; Rami: distorted; Niwe: wind-like energy

phrases.literal_translation: I am eliminating as I go along (the song)
I am clearing as I go along (the song)
I am releasing as I go along (the song)
In the Edge of the universe
phrases.cultural_note: The end of the universe; the maestro's vision goes to the end of the world, which represents a highly Divine consciousness

phrases.root_meaning: Maanhati: to descend, many objects or a mass; Bekanti: to welcome many
phrases.literal_translation: Are welcomed as they are descend
phrases.cultural_note: The spirits descend from that Divine realm

suffixes.meaning: do as you approach (plural or transitive)

phrases.root_meaning: to enter, many or a mass
phrases.cultural_note: Referring to the spirits that enter the maloka to perform the healing

phrases.root_meaning: to dance swaying back and forth
phrases.literal_translation: While dancing swaying back and forth excellently
phrases.cultural_note: The spirits are dancing, in celebration, swaying

phrases.literal_translation: I will make you all connect fully
phrases.cultural_note: Everyone in the maloka becomes connected to the spirits

phrases.root_meaning: Ja: that; Nete: universe; Pikoti: to take out
phrases.literal_translation: Once I take you out (and place you) in that (medicinal) the universe
phrases.cultural_note: The patients are being placed in the medicinal, Divine realms to be healed
The healer will wait, in the sense waiting to see and connect with the energies for appropriate diagnosis

phrases.literal_translation: those things from within your body
phrases.cultural_note: Of the distorted energies in all of the bodies

vocabulary.meaning: species of amazonian bird, symbolizing medicine, a doctor
to descend, many objects or a mass
to enter, many or a mass
to dance swaying back and forth

suffix_reference.meaning: do as you approach (plural or transitive)

alternative_translation.label: Alternative Translation
alternative_translation.note: works best with the alternative melody

lines.translation: Spirits of the plants and trees

lines.text: Listen I will care for you

lines.translation: Ride your lines all through the trees

phrases.root_meaning: Noya means 'Flying', Rao means 'medicine'. Flying Medicine. Rios from spanish Dios, God
phrases.cultural_note: Spirits of the Noya Rao tree

phrases.literal_translation: The Good energy with a fluttering sound (nice sound)
phrases.cultural_note: The energy is strong, so strong it flutters. It is also positive

phrases.literal_translation: Having made it (the energy) connect fully

phrases.root_meaning: person or man; species of amazonian bird, symbolizing medicine, a doctor
phrases.cultural_note: Referring to the medicine spirit
The anaconda symbolizes a powerful energy. This 'flat anaconda' is a different type of anaconda of great power, as opposed to a more common 'round' anaconda.

phrases.root_meaning: connection structure, anchor; from quechua 'pampa', plain, flatland; anaconda
phrases.cultural_note: The 'pampa' anaconda is so rare that it is revered as an animal with great power. For a healer to have 'domesticated' this rare spirit, it denotes great mastery.

phrases.literal_translation: The universe parrots anciently in line
phrases.cultural_note: The parrots symbolize the medicine of sound and words, in other words, an medicine frequency that provides the healer with icaros

phrases.root_meaning: to connect, anchor oneself; to descend, many objects or a mass
phrases.cultural_note: Connecting to all of these essences as they descend upon the healer

phrases.literal_translation: Expression referring to celebratory verbalizations, songs, prayers
phrases.cultural_note: Expression referring to celebratory verbalizations, songs, prayers
The ship refers to a vessel containing the dieta or medicine energy. It is a symbol for a medicine connection. The fact that is comes from the sky symbolizes celestial connections.

phrases.literal_translation: The great universe is laid out
phrases.cultural_note: The great universe is the most expanded state or realm, connection to Divinity

phrases.literal_translation: Once it falls with snake movements (zigzag)
phrases.cultural_note: This ship energy comes from the sky with a snake-like movement

phrases.literal_translation: Once gone and boarded all around (the medicine energy enters the body)
phrases.cultural_note: This Divine medicine energy enters the bodies
And so a great universe opens

phrases.root_meaning: From spanish Dios, God; mind, consciousness
phrases.literal_translation: Using God's mind/consciousness, by God's will
phrases.cultural_note: After connecting to all of these different forms of Divine energy, now through God's will

phrases.root_meaning: universe; from spanish torre, Tower; from spanish Campana, bell
phrases.cultural_note: The bell is a symbol of the medicinal frequency of sound, a special vibration to be channeled through the icaros.
Referring to ringing the bell

phrases.literal_translation: Will do the work on your bodies
phrases.cultural_note: With this sound, connected to Divinity and channeled through the icaros, the healer will work on the bodies. This special sound of Noya Rao bell is being channeled for the healing of the bodies through the icaro.

vocabulary.meaning: to be, iki present tense conjugation
to become organized in a line
to descend. Many objects or a mass
Noya means 'Flying', Rao means 'medicine'. Flying Medicine
species of amazonian bird, symbolizing medicine, a doctor

phrases.root_meaning: person or man; species of amazonian bird, symbolizing medicine, a doctor
phrases.cultural_note: Referring to the medicine spirits
They come from the highest vibration realms

phrases.root_meaning: to connect, anchor oneself; to descend, many objects or a mass
phrases.cultural_note: Rhythmic exclamation. These temples descend from the sky and the participants connect to them

phrases.literal_translation: Containing the Good universe laid out
phrases.cultural_note: This is how they describe the spirits. Full of positive energy
These are the healers, ceremony attendants

phrases.literal_translation: Containing the great universe laid out
phrases.cultural_note: Also describe this highest vibration realm within their bodies

phrases.root_meaning: From spanish Dios, God; city, village, settlement; to open
phrases.cultural_note: The city is a metaphor for a realm, describing an energy as seen in ayahuasca visions or dreams. In this case another way to describe Divine energy

phrases.root_meaning: from spanish torre, Tower; huge; line
phrases.cultural_note: The towers represent temples, which are symbols of divine frequency

phrases.root_meaning: aroma, perfume; shipibo embroidery; wind-like energy
phrases.cultural_note: The aroma and embroidery are also symbols of medicinal vibration

phrases.root_meaning: medicine; woman; to dance moving the legs back/forth, side to side
phrases.literal_translation: The medicine women (spirits) danced moving their legs (anciently)
phrases.cultural_note: The feminine medicine spirits appear dancing in the visions or dreams. Rhythmic exclamation

phrases.root_meaning: Golden; species of small hawk; to become organized in a line
phrases.literal_translation: The Golden Hawks aligned (in a line)
phrases.cultural_note: Hawks are also symbols of medicine as shown in visions or dreams. The hawk is revered as a smart bird, a powerful protector.
Everyone is connecting to all of these frequencies

phrases.root_meaning: universe; connection structure, anchor; From spanish Dios, God
phrases.cultural_note: Connections with the medicine spirits or gods
Birds represent song, music, harmony, beauty, in this case the plant spirits come in this form

phrases.root_meaning: universe; connection structure, anchor; wind-like energy
phrases.cultural_note: These are the medicine energies

phrases.root_meaning: to descend many or in mass; to bring
phrases.literal_translation: Come descending in mass as (I) bring them
phrases.cultural_note: They come towards the participants from the heavens

vocabulary.meaning: to become organized in a line
to descend. Many objects or a mass
to dance moving the legs back/forth, side to side
species of amazonian bird, symbolizing medicine, a doctor

phrases.root_meaning: My; connection structure, anchor; to become embroidered with Shipibo designs
phrases.cultural_note: The connection, being embroidered, symbolizes the various imprints from the dieta connections from many dietas and spiritual connections

phrases.root_meaning: person or man; species of amazonian bird, symbolizing medicine, a doctor
phrases.cultural_note: The spirits of the plants
Eara is the intransitive form of 'I'. He walks in the spiritual realms, is present in this ceremony.
The Gods are the spirits of the Noya Rao Tree

phrases.root_meaning: Noya means 'Flying', Rao means 'medicine'. Flying Medicine. Rios from spanish Dios, God
person or man; From spanish Pastor, a priest/pastor
phrases.cultural_note: The priests or pastors are symbols of Divine medicine energy. These frequencies come either in dreams or visions to connect the dietero to the Divine frequencies to channel these essences and behaviors. A dietero must behave like a 'priest', someone connected to the Divine and striving for a good life

phrases.root_meaning: From spanish, doctor; person or man
phrases.cultural_note: Spiritual doctors, as seen in visions or dreams are frequencies that are to be embodied by the dietero. To walk the doctor path is to walk the path of honesty and truth.
Connecting with these elements

phrases.root_meaning: I, intransitive; here; to do/be like this

suffixes.meaning: Will do, announcement of action, not immediate

phrases.literal_translation: I Will be like them here (to act, embody the spirits)
phrases.cultural_note: The healer will embody these divine frequencies with joy, he will act like the spirits

phrases.root_meaning: voice, word; species of amazonian bird, symbolizing medicine, a doctor
phrases.cultural_note: Referring to the medicinal quality of the words and voice. A medicinal expression.

phrases.root_meaning: My; voice, word; species of amazonian bird, symbolizing medicine, a doctor
phrases.cultural_note: Also referring to the potency of their prayers, connected to the plant spirits

phrases.root_meaning: person or man; to walk; to be

suffixes.meaning: once it just happened very recently, when it happened

phrases.literal_translation: When the (spirit) once walked as a man (in ancient times)
phrases.cultural_note: In other words, the maestro is saying: 'In some ancient times, the spirits walked as humans like us', expressing his desire to be close in relationship to the spirits. The '-ni' acts as an indefinite past. This construction represents a third person.

phrases.literal_translation: It was never so. (come close to the spirits)
phrases.cultural_note: But alas, it was not so. Healer expressing that the spirits have never been able to be like men (flesh and bones) in the memorable past of human existence. It is just a longing of this close relationship. He is 'flirting' with the spirits by expressing his desire to be with them.

phrases.root_meaning: voice, word; to obtain, receive; to clear, wipe
phrases.literal_translation: Once you receive the voice, clear it (for doing the healing)
phrases.cultural_note: The healer asks for the spirits to correct any negative words, if there was ever a time he did not express medicinally. In other words: 'Take my words and clear them, if I ever spoke ill', so he can do the healing
When it is like this, in the dieta container with students
Speaking to the feminine spirits connected to other realms, in higher frequencies, OR alternatively the students from other countries coming to join him.

phrases.literal_translation: I wish they were my hummingbird
phrases.cultural_note: He wishes the spirits were so closely related to him that they are like his hummingbirds. The hummingbird represents beauty and femininity. Alternatively, the maestro is also admiring the students from having all this medicinal energy in them.

phrases.root_meaning: person or man; to do/be like this

suffixes.meaning: Will do, announcement of action, not immediate

phrases.cultural_note: The students, if they study, will be healers like the maestro, with close relationships to the spirits.
Verb 'to be' is being used as a replacement of 'speak'
The spirits have looked and felt the words uttered by the maestro

vocabulary.meaning: to become embroidered with Shipibo designs
Noya means 'Flying', Rao means 'medicine'. Flying Medicine
species of amazonian bird, symbolizing medicine, a doctor

suffix_reference.meaning: once it just happened very recently, when it happened
ancient past tense / ancestral past tense indefinite
Will do, announcement of action, not immediate

phrases.literal_translation: I will connect fully with priority
phrases.cultural_note: Referring to the connection the maestro is making to their medicinal energy
Bringing the medicine energy to their body
Referring to the connection to medicinal realms of healing frequencies of plants

phrases.root_meaning: From spanish Dios, God; to connect, anchor oneself
phrases.cultural_note: Connection to God will always support the healer in their medicine work, this is the ultimate healing frequency to perform healing work
Connecting to their dieta energy

phrases.literal_translation: The powerful elements of the current energy

phrases.cultural_note: Referring to gathering the powerful dieta energies to 'pack them', make them solid, in their body
And from this gathering of energy, the maestro sings, with all this powerful medicinal frequency

phrases.root_meaning: strong, powerful; from spanish medico, doctor, to become a doctor
phrases.literal_translation: Will become the powerful doctor fully
phrases.cultural_note: As they embody all of these frequencies, they embody the doctor, they become a doctor.

phrases.root_meaning: from spanish medico, doctor, to become a doctor; to sing
phrases.literal_translation: Once I am done singing to become a doctor
phrases.cultural_note: The healer is fully connected and ready to channel medicine frequencies

phrases.literal_translation: Will work on behalf of the body
phrases.cultural_note: The healer begins the healing

phrases.literal_translation: Doing on behalf of while I sing
phrases.cultural_note: Doing on behalf in the sense of being of service with their icaro

phrases.root_meaning: your, plural possessive; body; to swirl, go round
to swirl, go round; wind-like energy
phrases.cultural_note: The swirling energies are the distorted energies that cause illness in the body

phrases.root_meaning: ungrounded, messy; wind-like energy; connection structure, anchor
phrases.cultural_note: Describing the energy as being scattered and ungrounded, stressful

phrases.literal_translation: You have been standing/walking in the past (in the distortion)
phrases.cultural_note: You (plural) have been walking in these stressful realms, these have been your habits for a long time (talking about the patients)

phrases.root_meaning: to walk, stand; to be. Present conjugation
phrases.literal_translation: You are the ones that have been standing in the past
phrases.cultural_note: You have been standing, living in the distortion
The healer waited, in the sense of performed a deep diagnosis
The clearing begins

phrases.root_meaning: body; inside; from within (suffix turned noun)
phrases.literal_translation: The elements from within your body
phrases.cultural_note: Referring to the distorted elements in the patients' bodies

phrases.root_meaning: to connect, anchor oneself; connection structure, anchor
phrases.cultural_note: These energies are anchored

phrases.root_meaning: Masa means 'distorted', shinan means 'mind'. Together it means 'worry'; to connect, anchor oneself
phrases.cultural_note: The worry is anchored, stuck in the patients' soma
After clearing the worry and stress, the healing brings the positive thoughts, a healthy mindset

phrases.literal_translation: I will make you receive as you go
phrases.cultural_note: Helps the patients receive this new mental state.

vocabulary.meaning: to be, riki is present tense conjugation
Masa means 'distorted', shinan means 'mind'. Together it means 'worry'
from spanish medico, doctor, to become a doctor

lines.translation: I am pleased and all is well
Spirits now I call to heal you
Men and women all will heal
I am pleased to be with you here
In my visions I'm with you
I call you to this healing place
I call the spirits to heal you
With this prayer I will heal you
Spirits of the plants shall come
They all dance among us now
With their joyous dance they heal
To you all I give this prayer
Spirits come to help me see
I will seek your illness now
In my mouth upon my tongue
With this song I heal you now
that will heal you from your ills
I am healing all your pain
Now the healing is all done
So don't be afraid  Have faith in God
Yet we know of other worlds
We, like healing plants can fly
Spirits come and sing with us / So that we can be prepared

alternative_translation.label: Alternative Translation
alternative_translation.note: works best with the alternative melody

lines.translation: Of the healing plants and trees / Doctors of the plants and trees / Come and join our ceremony / Come to heal us please
Kingly spirits of the forest / Queenly spirits of the trees
We will come and talk to you
Putting the world into place / With the sound of our voice / Spirits come and sing with us / So that we may change the world
We send our prayers up to god
Singing to heal ourselves / Singing to heal the world / Singing to bring great change
With the cushma of my diet
The cushma of the plants I dieted
I put it on to wear it and protect myself
And the crown of my diets
Of the plants I carry inside of me
I wear it to protect and guide me
And to the top of the tree as well
I prepare to go there and work
With my words and singing I seat myself there
In the top of the tree I work and sing through my pipe
This great machine of the plants
Through the magnetic resonance of my machine
And in the powerful singing that flows through me
I seat myself here in the center of my machine
Sitting myself here to work and sing
The dark energies that swirl around us
I fan these away with the great winds of the plants
To clean them and purify them
And to end all bad connections
And take them out from myself and you
I am taking out the bad
From your body it will go
I am taking out the bad
From your spirit it will go
I will take it all out
from your body all the bad
And it comes to all of us
Like the clear sound of a bell
Its soft tone helps me to heal
And keep removing all the bad
I will heal you and be done
Like the clear sound of the bell
Its soft tone helps me to heal
I pray with all my heart
and my powers go to you
With the song of my path
I'm going to end my diet
I'm going to protect my body
with the protection of the plants
I'm going to receive the energy
protecting my body with an arkana
With the song of my path
With the air of the plant doctors (Noyarao)
To sing from the trunk and throne
Now I am free to do my work / I am free to heal and see / I am free to do my work / I am free to heal and see
That let me do my work / That let me heal and see
Completion is near / Completion is here
As a doctor of the plants
And with power and grace I treat
Power of spirit in my hand
I plant doctors into me / I plant doctors into you
With the power of the doctor I will heal your body
This is the place to be
The best medicine country / And in this country I'm a doctor
First I'm going to give you the mareacion
and the machine of the effects
I place the antennae of my icaro line
Like the ones on my clothes
I will arrive at an ocean
I arrive in heaven / I purify you all
And here I walk and converse with aliens
To adorn our bodies with patterns
To adorn our bodies with designs
And these designs signify that we are strong
I connect it to my body
I build a bridge with it to my body
Healing with the words of my song
Your sadness that I see now

title: Kate Yonparibanon
note: Whilst learning this icaro you may sing it multiple times through, however in 'normal' ceremony conditions it should only be sung through once.

lines.translation: With these I surround us with protection
With all these I surround us with protection
With all these I surround us with protection
I wear my snake around my neck
Are placed in a cross in front of me
And I activate them with the words of my song

title: Nocon Yora Meabo
description: When in trouble, crossed, being attacked etc

lines.translation: I am cleaning and taking away
My words/speech (that have been affected negatively)
The bad things I am experiencing (in my mareacion),
The line of my diet sins.
I wash them with the blood of God
Blood that is exists beyond sin
I am connecting to the diets of the people of god
All of our energy lines and diets
Opening the worlds of the visions
Connecting you and walking along your lines
These things are now well connected
I am building a bridge to the diets of god
Connecting and transforming your whole diet.
I call the world of Noyarao to come
So that we are well connected
The boat of your diets have arrived
All the things of your diet
Liberating with the words of my song
I build a bridge to your mareacion
And a bridge to the world of your visions
Now that this kano is established
I am calling the spirit of a patient here
Calling them with the words of my song
And from here I perceive it.
That you have gathered to yourself
To the things I have seen in your body
